movies.title: Blue Spring
movies.plot: A group of a run-down Tokyo high school students face the struggles of growing up, growing apart from their friends and worrying about their future, while living in a highly violent environment.
movies.simplePlot: A group of a run-down Tokyo high school students face the struggles of growing up, growing apart from their friends and worrying about their future, while living in a highly violent environment.

biography.bio: The uniquely beautiful and talented Ryuhei Matsuda was born May 9, 1983, in the Tokyo Metropolis, to famous actors Miyuki Matsuda (née Kumagai) and Yûsaku Matsuda. Six years later, Ryuhei's life took a tragic turn when his father, at the age of 40, died from bladder cancer. Ryuhei and his mother persevered, and unlike most offspring of famous actors, he didn't give much thought to acting as a child. Nine years later, at the age of 15, that would all change when Ryuhei was approached by Nagisa Oshima with a life changing offer: to take on the prominent role as the androgynous youth, Samurai Sozaburo Kano in the controversial Gohatto. Ryuhei took the role head on, preparing himself emotionally and physically by practicing ken do for two months straight. His film debut was a success, and acted on par with the likes of Takeshi Kitano and Tadanobu Asano. For his hard work, Ryuhei was rewarded with critical acclaim and numerous awards. Shortly thereafter, he dropped out of high school to fully devote his time and efforts on his burgeoning film career, and with much success. Lightning would strike again for Ryuhei in 2001, in the dark, thought provoking high school drama, Blue Spring, directed by Toshiaki Toyoda. Such as with his debut, Ryuhei received yet more acclaim and this time, more widespread recognition for his role as the laid back, brutal, yet introspective high school gang leader, Kujo. The film roles kept coming, such as the 2003 reunion with writer director Toshiaki Toyoda in the acclaimed film 9 Souls, and a bit part in the flashy, comedic anime-to-film live action adaptation of Cutie Honey in the following year. Ryuhei's trend of working with some of Japan's most talented actors and directors continued in 2004 and in 2005 in the violent Takashi Miike action film, Izo, co-starring Takeshi Kitano and the up-coming Ranpo jigoku, co-starring Tadanobu Asano. With his charisma, talent, and ability to take on roles varying from the comedic, outrageous, moving, and controversial, the sky's the limit for this young man.
biography.name: Ryûhei Matsuda

biography.bio: Hirofumi Arai was born on January 18, 1979 in Hirosaki, Japan as Kyung-Sik Park. He is an actor, known for Confessions (2010), Blood and Bones (2004) and Go (2001).
biography.name: Hirofumi Arai

biography.bio: Sôsuke Takaoka was born on February 8, 1982 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Battle Royale (2000), 13 assassins (2010) and Break Through! (2004). He was previously married to Aoi Miyazaki.
biography.name: Sôsuke Takaoka

biography.bio: Yûsuke Ohshiba is an actor, known for Blue Spring (2001), Invisible Monster (2012) and 9 Souls (2003).
biography.name: Yûsuke Ohshiba

biography.bio: Yuta Yamazaki was born on March 8, 1981 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Blue Spring (2001), Fireworks, Should We See It from the Side or the Bottom? (2016) and Goodbye Mama (1991).
biography.name: Yuta Yamazaki

biography.bio: Shûgo Oshinari was born on March 5, 1981 in Chiba, Japan. He is an actor, known for All About Lily Chou-Chou (2001), Battle Royale II (2003) and Blue Spring (2001).
biography.name: Shûgo Oshinari

biography.bio: Takashi Tsukamoto was born on October 27, 1982 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Battle Royale (2000), Midnight Sun (2006) and Ikigami (2008).
biography.name: Takashi Tsukamoto

biography.bio: Eita was born on December 13, 1982 as Eita Nagayama. He is an actor, known for Memories of Matsuko (2006), Dear Doctor (2009) and Azumi (2003). He has been married to Kaela Kimura since September 1, 2010. They have one child.
biography.name: Eita

biography.bio: Onimaru is an actor, known for Tokyo Rampage (1998), Blue Spring (2001) and 9 Souls (2003).
biography.name: Onimaru

biography.bio: Kiyohiko Shibukawa was born on July 2, 1974 in Gunma Prefecture, Japan as Kiyohiko Tanaka. He is an actor, known for Ichi the Killer (2001), Fish Story (2009) and Big Bang Love, Juvenile A (2006).
biography.name: Kiyohiko Shibukawa

biography.bio: Kyôko Koizumi was born on February 4, 1966 in Atsugi, Kanagawa, Japan. She is an actress and writer, known for Tokyo Sonata (2008), Survive Style 5+ (2004) and Saigo kara nibanme no koi (2012). She was previously married to Masatoshi Nagase.
biography.name: Kyôko Koizumi

biography.bio: Mame Yamada was born on July 28, 1965 in Kobe, Japan as Hiromi Yamada. He is an actor, known for Tokyo Gore Police (2008), Strange Circus (2005) and Blue Spring (2001).
biography.name: Mame Yamada

biography.bio: Genta Dairaku is an actor, known for The Whispering of the Gods (2005), Why Don't You Play in Hell? (2013) and Blue Spring (2001).
biography.name: Genta Dairaku

biography.bio: Erena was born on February 9, 1983 in Kanagawa, Japan. She is an actress, known for One Missed Call (2003), Animusu anima (2005) and Blue Spring (2001).
biography.name: Erena

biography.bio: Nobuo Kyô was born on March 23, 1979 in Himeji, Hyogo, Japan as Nobuo Koyama. He is an actor, known for Ninpû sentai Harikenjâ (2002), Nana 2 (2006) and Ninpu Sentai Hurricaneger vs. Gaoranger (2003).
biography.name: Nobuo Kyô
